description: From Middle English benyghten, binighten, bynyȝten, equivalent to be- +‎ night.

verbs.description: benight (third-person singular simple present benights, present participle benighting, simple past and past participle benighted) (archaic, transitive)

entries.meaning: (chiefly in passive) To overtake (a traveller etc) with the darkness of night, especially before shelter is reached.
To darken; to shroud or obscure.
To plunge or be overwhelmed in moral or intellectual darkness.
examples: Can we whose souls are lighted
